dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Duffy (for himself and Mr. Heck) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To reform the Federal Insurance Office of the Department of the Treasury, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Insurance Office Reform Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Section 313 of title 31, United States Code, is amended as follows:

paragraph.text: In subsection (a), by inserting before the period at the end the following: , which shall be within the Office of International Affairs.
In the first sentence of subsection (b), by inserting before the period at the end the following: after consultation with State insurance commissioners.

clause.text: in subparagraph (E), by striking Federal efforts and all that follows through United States and inserting the following: Federal international insurance policy among Federal agencies and achieve consensus with the States, including representing the Department of the Treasury;

subclause.text: by striking to determine and inserting to assist the Secretary in determining; and
by inserting and after the semicolon at the end; and

clause.text: by striking subparagraph (G) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: to consult and reach consensus with the States (including State insurance regulators) on matters of international importance.
in paragraph (2), by striking major domestic and; and

clause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking may— and inserting may enter into information-sharing agreements.; and

paragraph.text: In subsection (f), by striking Director each place such term appears and inserting Secretary.

subparagraph.text: by striking to the extent the Director determines appropriate,; and

by inserting before the period at the end the following: and shall include in such meetings, State insurance commissioners, or at the option of the State insurance commissioners, designees acting at the direction of the State insurance commissioners, throughout the negotiations of a covered agreement.

paragraph.header: Retention of existing State regulatory authority
paragraph.text: In subsection (k), by inserting before the period at the end the following: or with the authority to participate in a supervisory college or similar regulatory process.
By striking subsections (o) and (p) and redesignating subsections (q) through (s) as subsections (o) through (q), respectively.
In subsection (p)(2), as so redesignated by paragraph (8)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
does not include new prudential requirements for United States insurers.

paragraph.text: In subsection (o), as so redesignated by paragraph (8) of this section—

subparagraph.text: by inserting not more than 5 after shall dedicate; and
by inserting , excluding the Director, after specific personnel.

subsection.text: Subparagraph (C) of section 313(c)(1) of title 31, United States Code, as so redesignated by subsection (a)(2)(A)(vi) of this section, is amended by striking subsection (r) and inserting subsection (p).
